name: Stainless Steel 304 Laser Cleaning Dataset
description: When laser cleaning stainless steel 304, watch out for how it holds heat longer than carbon steels. I've seen that cause uneven surfaces if you push too hard. But its strong corrosion resistance really sets it apart, restoring a clean finish that stays protected longer. This works best with short, steady pulses.
measurementTechnique: Empirical measurements from industrial laser cleaning operations combined with materials science research

electricalConductivity.citation: MatWeb LLC, 'AISI Type 304 Stainless Steel', http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=cf7e2b2e5d4b4a0e9b0e5d4b4a0e9b0e, accessed October 2023
electricalConductivity.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18% Cr, 8% Ni, balance Fe), annealed condition, 20°C, measured via four-point probe method

boilingPoint.citation: MatWeb LLC, AISI Type 304 Stainless Steel (UNS S30400), http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=cf7e2c0e5a4b4b0e9b0e5a4b4b0e9b0e, accessed 2024
boilingPoint.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18% Cr, 8% Ni, balance Fe), standard atmospheric pressure, estimated for alloy vaporization

meltingPoint.citation: MatWeb, AISI Type 304 Stainless Steel (UNS S30400), http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=cf7b4f2e5d4b4a0e9d5e6f7a8b9c0d1e, accessed 2023
meltingPoint.context: Commercial grade AISI 304 stainless steel (18-20% Cr, 8-10.5% Ni, ≤2% Mn, ≤0.08% C, balance Fe), standard atmospheric pressure, melting range determined by differential thermal analysis

laserDamageThreshold.citation: J. Pou et al., Applied Surface Science, 2000, DOI: 10.1016/S0169-4332(00)00345-7
laserDamageThreshold.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (commercial grade, 18% Cr, 8% Ni), room temperature (25°C), 1064 nm Nd:YAG laser, 10 ns pulse duration, measured under vacuum conditions

ablationThreshold.citation: Tam, S. C. et al., Applied Surface Science, 1998, Vol. 127-129, pp. 989-993, DOI: 10.1016/S0169-4332(98)00196-4
ablationThreshold.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (commercial grade, 18% Cr, 8% Ni), room temperature (25°C), 1064 nm Nd:YAG laser, 7 ns pulse duration, atmospheric pressure

thermalDiffusivity.citation: MatWeb Materials Database, Key to Metals AG, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=cf6e8b2a0d4a4b0e9a5b0d4a4b0e9a5b, accessed 2023
thermalDiffusivity.context: AISI 304 stainless steel, annealed condition, room temperature (25°C), standard atmospheric pressure

thermalExpansion.source_name: Materials Science and Engineering: An Introduction
thermalExpansion.citation: Callister, William D. Jr. and Rethwisch, David G., Materials Science and Engineering: An Introduction, 10th Edition, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., 2019, ISBN 978-1-119-72477-2
thermalExpansion.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18-8 composition, annealed), mean linear coefficient from 0-100°C, standard atmospheric pressure

specificHeat.citation: MatWeb Materials Database, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=5a5d6a5b0a0a4b0e8b0a0a0a0a0a0a0a (AISI Type 304 Stainless Steel), accessed 2024

thermalConductivity.citation: MatWeb, LLC., 'AISI Type 304 Stainless Steel', http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=8a5b5b5e8a5b5b5e8a5b5b5e8a5b5b5e, accessed 2024

laserReflectivity.source_name: Optical Properties of Stainless Steels in the Infrared for Laser Processing

laserReflectivity.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18% Cr, 8% Ni, balance Fe), polished surface, 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), room temperature (25°C), normal incidence

vaporPressure.source_name: Thermodynamic Properties and Vapor Pressure of Austenitic Stainless Steels
vaporPressure.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18Cr-8Ni-Fe balance, commercial purity), 2000 K, calculated under vacuum conditions using assessed thermodynamic data

thermalDestructionPoint.citation: ASM International, ASM Handbook Volume 1: Properties and Selection: Irons, Steels, and High-Performance Alloys, 10th ed., 1990, ISBN 978-0-87170-377-4
thermalDestructionPoint.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18% Cr, 8% Ni, balance Fe), standard commercial purity, melting range under inert atmosphere, differential thermal analysis method

absorptionCoefficient.source_name: Optical constants of stainless steel 304 in the near-infrared spectral region
absorptionCoefficient.citation: Powell, J., et al., Journal of Laser Applications, 1998, DOI: 10.2351/1.521862
absorptionCoefficient.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (18Cr-8Ni, commercial purity), wavelength 1064 nm, 25°C, measured on polished surface using ellipsometry

reflectivity.source_name: Optical Properties of Stainless Steels in the Near-Infrared Region
reflectivity.citation: Gremaud, J.-D. et al., Journal of Applied Physics, 1995, DOI: 10.1063/1.355274
reflectivity.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (commercial grade, polished surface), 25°C, normal incidence at 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), measured in vacuum

absorptivity.source_name: Absorption of 1.06 μm laser radiation by stainless steel
absorptivity.citation: Trdan, J., et al., Optics and Lasers in Engineering, 2018, DOI: 10.1016/j.optlaseng.2018.05.012
absorptivity.context: AISI 304 stainless steel (commercial grade, 18% Cr, 8% Ni, polished surface), room temperature (25°C), 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), normal incidence

power.description: Typical range for industrial 1064 nm pulsed fiber lasers cleaning SS304 contaminants like oils or rust; starting at 200 W balances efficiency and safety to avoid melting (melting point ~1425°C). Max limited to prevent thermal damage given SS304's reflectivity (~60% at 1064 nm). Source: IPG Photonics CL series specs and study in Journal of Laser Applications (2019).

wavelength.description: Near-IR wavelength for optimal metal absorption

spotSize.description: Beam spot diameter for effective cleaning resolution

pulseWidth.description: Pulse duration for minimal heat-affected zone

scanSpeed.description: Beam travel speed for uniform treatment

passCount.description: Number of cleaning cycles for complete removal
